Test.Comment:
PTS 1115359:
ALTER TABLE MODIFY: it should be allowed to modify a key as long as it is not part of a referential constraint

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE CE1 (KEY1 CHAR(15), COL1 CHAR(15), COL2 INT, PRIMARY KEY (KEY1))
ALTER TABLE CE1 MODIFY KEY1 CHAR(25)
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX I1 ON CE1 (COL1)
CREATE TABLE CE2 (KEY1 CHAR(25), COL1 CHAR(15), COL2 INT, PRIMARY KEY (KEY1), FOREIGN KEY (COL1) REFERENCES CE1(COL1))
ALTER TABLE CE1 MODIFY KEY1 CHAR(50)
CREATE TABLE CE3 (KEY1 CHAR(50), COL1 CHAR(50), COL2 INT, PRIMARY KEY (KEY1), FOREIGN KEY (COL1) REFERENCES CE1(KEY1))
ALTER TABLE CE1 MODIFY KEY1 CHAR(55)
ROLLBACK

Test.Comment: PTS 1115359: rewrite of record during ALTER TABLE MODIFY used wrong columns for checks when shortening columns and primary key was composed of several columns but not modified itself

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE CM1 (KEY1 CHAR(25), KEY2 CHAR(10), KEY3 INT, KEY4 CHAR(20), COL1 CHAR(15), COL2 FIXED(38), PRIMARY KEY (KEY1, KEY2, KEY3, KEY4))
INSERT INTO CM1 VALUES ('schl1', 'schl2', 54321, 'schl4', '012345678901234', 1)
ALTER TABLE CM1 MODIFY COL1 CHAR(10)

Error.ErrorMessage: Assignment impossible, char value too long
Alter column not allowed, constraint violation

Statement.CallString: UPDATE OF CM1 SET COL1='0123456789' WHERE KEY1='schl1'
ALTER TABLE CM1 MODIFY COL1 CHAR(10)
SELECT * FROM CM1
ROLLBACK

Test.Comment: PTS 1115359: in ALTER TABLE more than cak_maxlinkdef references led to an endless loop on several occasions:

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE C1 (KEY1 CHAR(25), KEY2 CHAR(10), COL0 CHAR(15), COL1 CHAR(20) NOT NULL, COL2 CHAR(15))
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX I1 ON C1(COL0)
CREATE TABLE CT1 (KEY1 CHAR(30), COL0 CHAR(15), FOREIGN KEY (COL0) REFERENCES C1(COL0))

Test.Comment: PTS 1115359, 1115360, 1115361: during rollback of a modified table with LONG/LONGFILE (and baserecord rewritten) LONG/LONGFILE trees existing already prior to the rewrite were deleted and kernel crashed:

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE CS1 (KEY1 CHAR(15), COL0 LONGFILE)
INSERT INTO CS1 VALUES ('abc', 'some text')
ALTER TABLE CS1 MODIFY KEY1 CHAR(10)
SELECT * FROM CS1
ROLLBACK

Test.Comment: PTS 1115403, PTS 1115401, PTS 115402: a table containing LONG columns would not insert any data into these LONG columns after an ALTER TABLE MODIFY reorganized the record on disk:

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE CG1 (KEY1 CHAR(15), COL0 LONG)
INSERT INTO CG1 VALUES ('key1', 'some text')
ALTER TABLE CG1 MODIFY KEY1 CHAR(25)
INSERT INTO CG1 VALUES ('key2', 'some more text')
SELECT * FROM CG1
ROLLBACK

Test.Comment: PTS 1115778, PTS 1115774: implementation of ALTER TABLE ... ADD ... DEFAULT and ALTER TABLE ... ADD ... SERIAL; Test 1: Add various default values to table

Statement.CallString: DROP TABLE CT1
CREATE TABLE CT1 (KEY1 CHAR(15), PRIMARY KEY (KEY1), COL1 CHAR(25))
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k0.5','col1.5')
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k1.5','col1.5')
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k2.5','col1.5')
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA1 CHAR(30) DEFAULT 'another default'
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA2 INT DEFAULT 37
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA3 CHAR(65) DEFAULT NULL
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA4 INT DEFAULT SERIAL
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU2 CHAR (12) DEFAULT 'uuu' CONSTRAINT RANGECHECK CHECK NEU2 BETWEEN 'sss'AND 'www'

ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU3 CHAR (12) DEFAULT 'vvv' CONSTRAINT RANGECHECK1 CHECK NEU3 BETWEEN 'sss'AND 'www', NEU4 LONG
/* combination of column with constraints and long column */ /* used to result in a kernel crash (PTS 1120938) */
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU5 CHAR (12) NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU6 CHAR (12) NOT NULL DEFAULT '15'
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU7 CHAR (12) NOT NULL DEFAULT '7' CONSTRAINT ANOTHERONE CHECK NEU7 BETWEEN '5'AND '9'
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k3.5','col2.5')
SELECT * FROM CT1
DROP TABLE CT1
COMMIT

Test.Comment: PTS 1115778, PTS 1115774: implementation of ALTER TABLE ... ADD ... DEFAULT ... and ALTER TABLE ... ADD ... SERIAL; Test 2: trigger errors

Statement.CallString: DROP TABLE CT1
CREATE TABLE CT1 (KEY1 CHAR(15), PRIMARY KEY (KEY1), COL1 CHAR(25), SEQ SERIAL)
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('K0.5','COL1.5')
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k1.5','col1.5')
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k2.5','col1.5')
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA1 LONG DEFAULT 'another default'

Error.ErrorMessage: DEFAULT specification not allowed for this column:EXTRA1

Statement.CallString: ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA1 LONGFILE DEFAULT 'another default'

Error.ErrorMessage: DEFAULT specification not allowed for this column:EXTRA1

Statement.CallString: ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU2 CHAR (12) DEFAULT 'ggg' CONSTRAINT RANGECHECK CHECK NEU2 BETWEEN 'sss'AND 'www'

Error.ErrorMessage: DEFAULT value must be in constraint specification:EXTRA1

Statement.CallString: ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA1 INT DEFAULT SERIAL

Error.ErrorMessage: More than one column with default SERIAL not allowed

Statement.CallString: ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA2 CHAR(15) DEFAULT 'a default', EXTRA3 LONG
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU LONG NOT NULL
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU LONG NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT

Error.ErrorMessage: [-7035] (at 32768): DEFAULT specification not allowed for this column:NEU

Statement.CallString: ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD NEU LONG NOT NULL DEFAULT '5'

Error.ErrorMessage: [-7035] (at 32768): DEFAULT specification not allowed for this column:NEU

Statement.CallString: DROP TABLE CT1
COMMIT

Test.Comment: PTS 1115778, PTS 1115774: implementation of ALTER TABLE ... ADD ... DEFAULT and ALTER TABLE ... ADD ... SERIAL; Test 3: check that a dropped SERIAL is properly flushed from the sequence cache

Statement.CallString: DROP TABLE CT1
CREATE TABLE CT1 (KEY1 CHAR(15), PRIMARY KEY (KEY1), COL1 CHAR(25))
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k0.5','col1.5')
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k1.5','col1.5')
INSERT CT1 (KEY1, COL1) VALUES ('k2.5','col1.5')
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA1 INT DEFAULT SERIAL
SELECT * FROM CT1
ALTER TABLE CT1 DROP EXTRA1
ALTER TABLE CT1 ADD EXTRA1 INT DEFAULT SERIAL
SELECT * FROM CT1
DROP TABLE CT1
COMMIT

Test.Comment: PTS 1118454: ALTER TABLE ... DROP CONSTRAINT ... for foreign keys

Statement.CallString: create table t (col1 int primary key, col2 char)
create table t1 (col1 int CONSTRAINT CONSTR1 REFERENCES T, col2 char, col3 int constraint constr2 references T)
insert t values (1,'1')
insert t1 values (1,'1',1)
alter table t1 drop constraint constr1
insert t1 values (2,'2',2)
insert t1 values (2,'2',1)
select * from t1
drop table t1
drop table t

Test.Comment: PTS 1118658: Alter Table ... Modify ... Null can not be used for key columns

Statement.CallString: Create Table t (k1 int, k2 char(15), primary key (k1,k2), c1 int not null)
Alter Table t Modify c1 null
Alter Table t Modify k2 null
Alter Table t Drop Primary Key
Alter Table t Modify k2 null
Drop Table t

Test.Comment: PTS 1126756: verify fix for crash on drop named constraint if given constraint does not exist, but table has named constraints

Statement.CallString: create table t (col1 int primary key, col2 char)
create table t1 (col1 int CONSTRAINT CONSTR1 REFERENCES T, col2 char, col3 int constraint constr2 references T)
alter table t1 drop constraint asdf
alter table t1 drop constraint constr1
drop table t1
drop table t
